measured_by: number of earlier same-day forecasts (DECISION RANK)
justification: “we assume that fatigue increases with the number of forecasts the analysts have already issued that day… the number of recently issued forecasts provides a proxy for analyst decision fatigue.”

measured_by: RELATIVE ACCURACY metric (standardized difference between analyst and median forecast error)
justification: “we therefore define RELATIVE ACCURACY… the analyst’s EPS forecast error minus the median forecast error for all analysts… divided by the standard deviation of EPS forecast errors.”

measured_by: HERDING dummy (forecast between consensus and own prior forecast)
justification: “Following Clement and Tse (2005), we define HERDING… value 1 if analyst’s forecast is between the consensus forecast and his own previous forecast, and 0 otherwise.”

measured_by: REISSUE dummy (indicator that forecast is a reissued previous forecast)
justification: “We also estimate a new measure, REISSUE… a dummy variable that takes the value of 1 if a forecast is reissued (self-herding), and 0 otherwise.”
“Following Dechow and You (2012), we define ROUNDING… a dummy variable that takes the value of 1 if a forecast ends with zero or five in the penny digit, and 0 otherwise.”
